item.description:
It's been great the last two months seeing some new faces both human and pug. 

Congrats go out to Lisa St Pierre for winning the April raffle basket.  Riley - sorry that toy didnt last a bit longer for you. 

I want to assure everyone that our pushy visitor from this afternoon will NOT be back. Also wanted to fill you in some storyline gaps on that woman.  About a year ago January she joined the meetup and showed up trying to sell a little puppy. Organizers asked her to leave as that is not what our group is about.  It took me a minute to realize it was the same woman today. Julie knew right off the bat and tried to nip the situation in the bud as soon as possible. Anyway - we tried to tell her a few times she wasnt welcome and our play group is for the puggies to socialize and have fun and not for a breeding program.  Some of us in the group volunteer for one or more pug rescues and know this is not something a reputable breeder would do. Julie filled Bob ( the owner of Gibson Kennels) in on what happened and he assured us she won't be back.  It left a bad vibe with me and Julie and we hope that the incident doesn't stop anyone from bringing their pugs to future meetups.

Speaking of Gibson's - be sure your pug(s) are up to date with all vaccines - they should definatley be vaccinated for Bortadella ( Kennel Cough) in the setting we are in. ( Its a good idea to keep a copy of your dogs vaccines in your car just in case Gibsons asks)

This is a PUG only meetup.  There are other small breed meetups out there for your mixed breed. Please keep an eye on your own dog(s)

Reminder that there is a $5.00 fee ( I like the term "Dues" better) per family. The majority of the dues collected goes to meetup costs.  What are meetup costs? the meetup website costs $45 every three months. I set up a spreadsheet and have started keeping a " free parking" ( monopoly game reference) kitty for future pondering. 

Remember to keep your pugs safe from Ticks. Also keep in mind with spring blossoms and planting - know what's in your lawn fertilizer and what plants can be toxic to your pets. 

Looking foward the May meetup. 

enjoy the Spring!

Laura
item.name: The Grafton Pug Meetup Group Monthly Meetup
